item.title: Beogram 4000: Installation of Hood Mounting Screw Springs
item.description:

These springs make removing and attaching the hood significantly easier. After consulting the service manuals, it’s clear that the Beogram 4000 was not designed with these springs. item.title: Beogram 4000: Polishing the Hood
item.description:
As a final step in restoring a Beogram 4000 turntable, the author polished its dust cover. This is a multi-step process that can take several hours, especially since this cover had significant damage. The author began by protecting the Bang & Olufsen logo with layers of insulation tape to prevent accidental sanding. They then used 220-grit sandpaper to smooth out the deep scratches, leaving a surface that resembled wood. To restore the shine, they progressed through approximately ten grades of sandpaper and micro-mesh polishing cloths, finishing with a polishing liquid...

item.title: Beogram 4000: Polishing the Hood and a Strange Hinge Pin
item.description:
I’m completing the restoration of a Beogram 4000 turntable by addressing the final detail: polishing the dust cover. This one, like many I’ve encountered, had scratches from improper storage. This particular unit had a non-original hinge pin, longer than the original, causing it to protrude. I shortened it, restoring a flush fit. The aluminum trim on the other side had also detached, which I reattached using double-sided tape for easy future removal...
